The Christian Lifestyle – A New Life in Christ

The Christian lifestyle is a transformation, a new beginning that starts when a person accepts Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior. It means dying to the old self and living a renewed life empowered by the Holy Spirit.

“Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a new creature: old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new” (2 Corinthians 5:17).

This new life brings peace, joy, and purpose that come from a relationship with God.

Being a Christian is not just about beliefs but about daily choices that reflect Christ’s character. Ellen White encourages believers,

“True godliness is a practical matter. It pervades the whole being and regulates every relation of life.” (Steps to Christ, p. 70)

This includes how we think, speak, and interact with others.

Walking in the new life means continuous growth and sanctification. The Christian is called to

“put off concerning the former conversation the old man, which is corrupt according to the deceitful lusts”

and to

“put on the new man, which after God is created in righteousness and true holiness” (Ephesians 4:22-24).

This is a daily surrender and reliance on Christ’s power.

The Christian lifestyle also involves loving God and others wholeheartedly. Jesus summarized the law and prophets with two great commandments:

“Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart... and thy neighbour as thyself” (Matthew 22:37-39).

Ellen White explains,

“True love is the evidence of a transformed heart.” (The Desire of Ages, p. 414)

Living as a Christian means being set apart for God’s purposes, reflecting His light in a dark world. It involves integrity, humility, service, and witness. As Paul wrote,

“Ye are the light of the world.” (Matthew 5:14)

Ellen White urges,

“Let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.” (Christ’s Object Lessons, p. 342)

In conclusion, the Christian lifestyle is a daily walk of faith, love, and obedience. It is the new life Christ offers to all who believe—a life empowered by the Spirit, marked by godly character and love for others. Ellen White reminds us that this transformation is the greatest miracle:

“The new birth is not a temporary work; it is a transformation of character.” (Steps to Christ, p. 62)

Embrace this new life and live fully for Christ.
